name: evaporation
content:
evaporation noun [U]
(BECOMING GAS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of a liquid changing to a gas, especially by heating: Ice cover prevents evaporation of water from the lake surface. Fruit juice is concentrated through evaporation.
More examplesFewer examplesThe salt deposits were formed by the evaporation of ancient seas millions of years ago. Using a hand mister to wet your plants will cut down on water loss from evaporation.The evaporation of sweat lowers the body temperature.

evaporation noun [U]
(DISAPPEARANCE)
the fact of something disappearing: As a boy, he was aware of the evaporation of his grandfather's life savings. Political events caused an evaporation of confidence in the nation’s currency.
More examplesFewer examplesPolitical events caused an evaporation of confidence in the nation’s currency.He faced the evaporation of his political ambitions.People were angry and fearful about the evaporation of civil society.
